At-a-Glance: Dry, well-ventilated hives winter better and suffer fewer mould issues. Remove moist air without chilling clusters.
Why it Matters: Condensation drips onto clusters, chilling bees and brood. Balanced airflow preserves energy and reduces disease pressure.
Step-by-Step: Use open-mesh floors where appropriate; ensure roofs are sound; add top ventilation or quilt boards in damp climates; tilt hives slightly forward to shed condensation; avoid large empty headspace above clusters in winter.
Seasonality & Climate: Maritime climates prioritise moisture removal; continental winters need protection from drafts while venting humidity.
Common Pitfalls: Over-sealing hives leading to damp, or over-ventilating so clusters struggle to maintain temperature.
Tools & Materials: Mesh floors, quilt boards, breathable insulation, entrance reducers, shims, reliable roof coverings.
